intro: Acerates decumbens, commonly known as the decumbent acerates, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with stems that lie flat on the ground and often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, hairy leaves that are typically oval or lance-shaped, and it blooms with yellowish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
